  16. (* Definition of environment variables *)

  18. type value = string

  20. ‌type exporter = value -> string * string

  22. ‌type t = {
  23.   variable_name : string;
  24.   variable_description : string;
  25.   variable_exporter : exporter
  26. }

  28. ‌let compare v1 v2 = String.compare v1.variable_name v2.variable_name

  30. exception Empty_variable_name

  32. exception Variable_already_registered of string

  34. exception No_such_variable of string

  36. ‌let default_exporter varname value = (varname, value)

  38. ‌let make (name, description) =
  39.   if name="" then raise Empty_variable_name else {
  40.     variable_name = name;
  41.     variable_description = description;
  42.     variable_exporter = default_exporter name
  43.   }

  45. ‌let make_with_exporter exporter (name, description) =
  46.   if name="" then raise Empty_variable_name else {
  47.     variable_name = name;
  48.     variable_description = description;
  49.     variable_exporter = exporter
  50.   }

  52. ‌let name_of_variable v = v.variable_name

  54. ‌let description_of_variable v = v.variable_description

  56. ‌let (variables : (string, t) Hashtbl.t) = Hashtbl.create 10

  58. ‌let register_variable variable =
  59.   if Hashtbl.mem variables variable.variable_name
  60.   then raise (Variable_already_registered variable.variable_name)
  61.   else Hashtbl.add variables variable.variable_name variable

  63. ‌let find_variable variable_name =
  64.   try Some (Hashtbl.find variables variable_name)
  65.   with Not_found -> None

  67. ‌let string_of_binding variable value =
  68.   let (varname, value) = variable.variable_exporter value in
  69.   Printf.sprintf "%s=%s" varname value

  71. let get_registered_variables () =
  72. ‌  let f _variable_name variable variable_list = variable::variable_list in
  73.   List.sort compare (Hashtbl.fold f variables [])
